title: Take an Ability and Super-Charge it.  Now Give it a Super Disappointing Downside.
body:
The downside can either be from on the ability or from everyone else countering said ability.  I'll start.

{{champion:30}} Ult: Higher Base, Higher Scaling, Disables ALL healing(including fountain), goes through invuln, and ignores shields.  However it has a cooldown of 600 seconds and is unaffected by CDR.

{{champion:10}} Ult: Makes target immune to CC but cuts their damage output in half.

{{champion:77}} Turtle Stance:  Provides healing as an effect instead of lifesteal, but turrets now give off more powerful Grievous Wounds that reduces by 80% instead of 40%.

replies.body: {{champion:99}} : Ult is global and has massive damage. Is as wide as a yasuo q.

Slices and dices your opponent multiple times,gives you free armor pen and cc the target enemy,
however in order to hit the target must be airborne  ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡° )
Id say more like Karthus ultimate kills entire enemy team but their team is put into a Zhonyas stance for twice as long as the longest enemy death timer. With 600 second cooldown at 40% CDR.
(Old) {{champion:107}}  Q does less damage, but now it has a higher cooldown and lasts for only one second so you have to break your keyboard to get a tripleQ off. Hang on...

{{champion:35}} Gets a rework but has his kneecaps broken shortly afterward.
---
Am I doing it right?
{{champion:143}} W stacks to 5 at 200% the rate they currently stack.  Plants will also now attack allies.
